.
Automatic 38 U.S.C. 1318 DIC Payments to Eligible Surviving Spouses
Effective July 7, 2014, VA automatically pays
38 U.S.C. 1318
DIC to an eligible surviving spouse, without a claim, when VA is able to determine eligibility based on evidence of record as of the date of the Veteran's death.
A surviving spouse must file a claim for other DIC benefits.
Note
:  The automated payment is triggered by the FIRST NOTICE OF DEATH command and paid to the surviving spouse established on the award at the time of the Veteran’s death.
Reference
:  For more information on automatic burial payments to eligible surviving spouses, see
M21-1, Part XI, Subpart iii, 1.A.3.a
.
